betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Sending plain messages is §cnot particularly safe§r as §canyone with malicious intent can spoof their network card and pick your messages up§r.

By using a §a§eData Card of any tier§r, you can add some security to your network (§7the T3 data card being the best option§r).

You may also use a §6Linked Card§r to §atransport information from one computer to a single other computer§r §eno matter the distance or dimension§r. Although be wary, §cthis consumes LOTS of power§r.

As for your physical network, it is recommended you §ahave a power distributor or a relay in order to separate components§r, so the computers don’t get their components mixed up or use the same component.

A relay may also use a §6Wireless Network Card§r of any tier to receive messages wirelessly.
